SOCKNET::Connexion

SOCKNET::Connexion Class Reference

Definition of objects with possibility of waiting to select events due to network actibity A connexion object represents a socket with a access state. Such object allows to select them from a set in order to deals with communication events. See also the Selector class. A Connexion object has a name (an integer) and a state (connected, disconnected, under connection). The class does not provide method to establish connexion. It should be defined into derived class. A connexion could be attached to a Selector, see above. More...

#include <socknet_selector.h>

Detailed Description

Definition of objects with possibility of waiting to select events due to network actibity A connexion object represents a socket with a access state. Such object allows to select them from a set in order to deals with communication events. See also the Selector class. A Connexion object has a name (an integer) and a state (connected, disconnected, under connection). The class does not provide method to establish connexion. It should be defined into derived class. A connexion could be attached to a Selector, see above.

Connexion

Destroy Should be redefined in derived class.

SOCKNET::Connexion::Connexion (  )  [protected]

Constructor Build an non initialized, non connected connexion without name. The user should call initialize before any use of such object.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void SOCKNET::Connexion::connect (  )  [pure virtual]

connect Connect the socket to the peer or throw an exception

Exceptions:
ComFailure with an error code if the connexion failed
InvalidArgumentError is the connexion is not properly initialized

Implemented in SOCKNET::Channel.
